memberdef.type: typename detail::TypeSeqRange< TypeSeqIn, Start, End, Start >::type
memberdef.definition: using type_seq_range_t = typename detail::TypeSeqRange<TypeSeqIn, Start, End, Start>::type
memberdef.name: type_seq_range_t

briefdescription.para: A tool to get a subset of a TypeSeq by slicing [Start:End].
Concatenate type sequences into a new type sequence. This is similar to type_seq_merge_t but it does not remove duplicate elements.

parameterdescription.para: The type sequences to be concatenated.

briefdescription.para: A tool to find the grid that is defined along the specified dimension (e.g. get GridX from X)
Get a TypeSeq containing all unique types from the original TypeSeq.

parameterdescription.para: The original TypeSeq which may contain duplicate types.

briefdescription.para: Determine if a type sequence only contains unique elements.
